case_vignette: A 7-year-old boy is brought to the physician by his parents because of concerns about his behavior at school over the past year. He often leaves his seat and runs around the classroom, and has a hard time waiting for his turn. His teacher is also concerned. His behavior is a little better at home, but he frequently acts out inappropriately. The boy was born at 39 weeks' gestation via spontaneous vaginal delivery. He is up to date on all vaccines and is meeting all developmental milestones. He has never had a serious illness and takes no medications. At the physician’s office, the boy wanders around the exam room during the examination. He does not seem to listen to directions and talks incessantly.
question: Which  elements in the boy's history is most consistent with the likely diagnosis in this patient?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Pediatrics and Neonatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I often leave my seat and run around the classroom, have a hard time waiting for my turn, and I act out inappropriately a lot.
Is this behavior in a child under the age of 12?
Yes, I'm 7 years old.
Final Diagnosis: Attention Deficit Hyperactivity Disorder (ADHD)

trial_0.vignette_mcq:
The correct choice is: Excessive talking.

The symptoms described in the case scenario are consistent with Attention Deficit Hyperactivity Disorder (ADHD), specifically the hyperactive-impulsive subtype. ADHD is characterized by symptoms of inattention, hyperactivity, and impulsivity. The excessive talking and difficulty staying seated and waiting for turns are common symptoms of the hyperactive-impulsive subtype. Episodes of severe mood elevation, hearing voices, and believing one can fly are symptoms of other conditions, such as bipolar disorder or psychosis, respectively.

No, I am 7 years old.

Given your symptoms and no previous diagnosis or medication use, I would consider the possibility of Attention Deficit Hyperactivity Disorder (ADHD). However, a thorough evaluation by a healthcare professional is necessary for an accurate diagnosis.

**Final Diagnosis:**
Possible Attention Deficit Hyperactivity Disorder (ADHD)

Please consult a healthcare professional for proper evaluation and treatment.
